On Saturday at 10:30 AM PT I'm hosting a town hall to have a conversation about what‚Äôs happening in Congress right now, what to expect in the year ahead, & the issues that matter most to you & your family. I hope to see you there.

https://t.co/J4WEgTjEDQ

As Putin threatens Ukraine and tries to divide the West, NATO stands united.

After this trip, I remain confident in our strong network of partners and allies. We must continue working with them to build a more stable, just, and peaceful world. https://t.co/poBnSASDZr

During the trip we had crucial conversations with our partners about our most pressing global security challenges.
 
At a time when anti-democratic leaders are threatening freedoms around the world, these conversations could not have been more important.

This week I returned from an international trip as part of a Congressional Delegation led by @SpeakerPelosi. While in Europe I visited Poland, Estonia, Germany, and England, engaging with leaders in each country along the way. https://t.co/kNUBuyuhIB

I‚Äôll be joining @TheWilsonCenter tomorrow for a virtual conversation with @AmbassadorGreen about the latest developments in Eastern Europe as Putin‚Äôs aggression toward Ukraine continues.

Tune in at 9:30am PT / 12:30pm ET: https://t.co/Jakf2leF7C
The Senate must pass this bill so that we can adequately address disparities in mental health and ensure that Black Americans have equal access to mental health care. (4/4)

This bill would also provide grants to establish behavioral health teams, develop culturally competent mental health services, and strengthen the diversity in the workforce pipeline for mental health professionals. (3/4)
This bill would increase funding for research into mental and physical health disparities that Black communities currently face. (2/4)
As we continue to celebrate #BlackHistoryMonth, with a focus on Black Health and Wellness, I‚Äôm proud to support the Pursuing Equity in Mental Health Act. (1/4)

I'm thrilled to see Julian Purdy recognized for his immense contributions to our country and Veterans.

Julian worked in my office for 3+ years, starting as a @wwp fellow and focusing on Veterans policy. During that time I saw his devotion and commitment to our nation firsthand. https://t.co/QkyGWMRqCT

NS2 will not move forward. Russian oligarchs are losing access to the global financial system.

As @POTUS just said, these consequences are just a taste of what Russia‚Äôs economy faces if Putin‚Äôs aggression against Ukraine continues.

We are united in holding him accountable. https://t.co/dXPVAHYnQY

This bill would: 
-improve data collection on health equity, 
-establish an Office of Civil Rights & Health Equity, 
-prohibit health care providers from providing inequitable health care, 
-and provide grants for hospitals to promote equitable health care outcomes. (3/3)

I am proud to be an original cosponsor of the Equal Health Care for All Act, which would treat equitable health care as a civil right to combat the disproportionate health outcomes faced by Black communities. (2/3)
February is #BlackHistoryMonth. This year's theme is Black Health and Wellness, which serves as a reminder for the urgent need to address health disparities facing Black communities. (1/3)

Thanks to funding from the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw, over 10 million households are now enrolled in the Affordable Connectivity Program, the nation‚Äôs largest ever program to help families afford high-speed internet.

Putin‚Äôs threats toward Ukrainian freedom, democracy, and sovereignty must end.

President Biden, our allies, and our partners have stepped up the pressure in response ‚Äî Putin must know that further aggression will be met with increasingly devastating economic consequences. https://t.co/JjomuxMQMc

Now ‚Äì because of this investment ‚Äì electric vehicles will be an increasingly practical option for Americans with more convenient, reliable, and affordable charging. And this shift to EVs will also create good-paying union jobs. (2/2)

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law invests $7.5B in EV charging stations to #ElectrifyAmerica with greener transportation. (1/2)

Black migrants are treated differently at our borders, in our courts, and by our immigration officials - they remain in detention longer, pay higher bonds for release, and are time and time again not given a fair opportunity to seek asylum. (1/2)
As a proud co-sponsor of the #MomnibusAct, I urge action in Congress to ensure passage in the Senate so that we can advance birth equity in America. (4/4)

Our country has the highest rate of maternal mortality in the developed world and that rate is worse among Black communities. Led by @RepUnderwood and Members of the @BMHCaucus, #Momnibus is a sweeping package of bills intended to address this crisis. (3/4)
In November, the House passed important provisions of the Black Maternal Health #MomnibusAct, the largest investment in our history to address maternal mortality. (2/4)
February is #BlackHistoryMonth. This year's theme is Black Health and Wellness, which serves as a reminder for the urgent need to address health disparities facing Black communities. (1/4)

Congratulations, Scott, on your nomination. (2/2)

At this crucial moment, I'm proud to be joining @SpeakerPelosi and the Congressional delegation to Germany, where @VP Harris will also be meeting with U.S. allies from across Europe. https://t.co/MNdfhSPLC8

When our military reflects the rich diversity of our entire country, the United States is safer and stronger.

Representation matters ‚Äî period. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/lQg2ilcLs5

Together, we are #ElectrifyingAmerica. (2/2)

Last week @POTUS announced $7.5B in funding to build a national EV charging network. 

Washington alone will receive $10M this year to invest in EV charging infrastructure. The funding was made possible by the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law that Congress passed last year. (1/2) https://t.co/yqRyn1ReH2

These workers are demanding better wages and benefits, but the actions by employers seem to indicate a greater interest in undermining unions rather than coming to the table to negotiate in good faith.

Read my full statement on the strike here: (2/2) https://t.co/9ueDPfaOJu

Across King County, an unfair labor practice strike has been taking place for nearly ten weeks. As a result, the region‚Äôs six major concrete suppliers have laid off thousands of workers.

Today I visited some of the Teamsters Local 174 union members at the picket line. (1/2) https://t.co/sDPw8fFG6N

As we address the homelessness crisis across the country ‚Äì working to uplift the unhoused community and transition these individuals to more permanent housing ‚Äì creative solutions like safe parking programs will be vital to our success. (4/4)

This bill would effectively create and strengthen safe parking programs across the country, which provide unhoused individuals living in vehicles with a safe place to park overnight and services including rehousing assistance and case management. (3/4)

H.R. 2965, the Naomi Schwartz Safe Parking Program Act of 2021, would direct @HUDgov to establish grants for safe parking programs operated by local governments, tribes, nonprofit organizations, and other organizations that support the homeless community. (2/4)

Homelessness is a rising concern in many communities across the country. Many community members experiencing homelessness live in their cars, which can present serious safety risks.‚ÄØ

I'm proud to cosponsor @RepCarbajal's legislation, which addresses this issue. (1/4)

The United States is shining a bright light on Vladimir Putin's aggressive behavior toward Ukraine.

If Russia further invades Ukraine, the blame is Putin's alone. Period.¬†
¬†
I joined @MSNBC today to discuss U.S. efforts with our allies and partners to keep that from happening. https://t.co/akvIDkYKn7

Gun violence has claimed the lives of too many in the United States.

Congressional action is long overdue. (3/3)

The Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School shooting is a glaring example of the urgent need for commonsense gun reform legislation that would prevent a teenager from possessing a semi-automatic rifle. (2/3)

Four years ago, a gunman walked into a school in Parkland, Florida with a semi-automatic rifle and opened fire, taking the lives of 17 students and teachers.

Today is a tragic day of remembrance, as we honor those who lost their lives in this despicable act of violence. (1/3)

If Putin further invades Ukraine, the consequences for Russia would be severe ‚Äî economically, diplomatically, and across Eastern Europe.

I discussed the latest developments today with @FWhitfield on @CNN. Watch: https://t.co/FwkKRFOqND

The COVID-19 pandemic has caused major disruptions in our supply chains. The #AmericaCOMPETES Act will invest $45 billion to improve our nation‚Äôs supply chains to prevent shortages of critical goods and ensure more of them are made right here in the United States.

Creating strong pathways to high-quality, good paying jobs is vital for the success of America's workforce. 

I look forward to working with my colleagues to reach a final agreement on the #AmericaCOMPETES Act that includes this important piece of legislation. (4/4)

This assistance will reduce financial barriers that many workers face and will ensure that both pre-apprenticeship programs and apprenticeship programs are more widely accessible for individuals with barriers to employment. (3/4)

I am incredibly proud that a bill I crafted was included in this legislation. My bill will enable pre-apprenticeship programs to offer stipends to pre-apprentices to assist with financial costs of participating in these programs such as housing, childcare, & transportation. (2/4)

As Americans file their taxes, the IRS is facing unprecedented challenges processing returns. While the COVID-19 pandemic has strained every federal agency, the impact on the IRS has been particularly severe. (2/3)

I commend @Ameriburn and @harborviewmc for the incredible work they are doing to bring awareness to these injuries and to support the innovative solutions that will save lives and help patients fully recover. (5/5)

The Regional Burn Center at Harborview is the only @Ameriburn verified burn center in the state - with a 97% survival rate for patients treated there. 

@harborviewmc is also doing important work to inform our communities about prevention, safety, and treatment. (4/5)

Across our country, burn injuries continue to be one of the leading causes of accidental injury and death. 

In my home state of Washington, @harborviewmc is doing exceptional research and work to advance burn care therapies and help patients recover quickly. (3/5)

The theme for this year's National Burn Awareness Week is ‚ÄúBurning Issues in the Kitchen" - where risk of these injuries is common.

Here is a fact sheet from the American Burn Association, which includes safety practices when cooking in the kitchen: https://t.co/sIiagGC8jc (2/5)

This week is National Burn Awareness Week, an opportunity to call attention to the causes of burn injuries and to highlight prevention and safety measures we can take to avoid these devastating kinds of injuries. #NBAW (1/5)

I proudly stand with the LGBTQ+ community around the world as I take this vote today and I urge passage in the Senate to protect these individuals from unacceptable and intolerable violations of their basic human rights. (3/3)

It is imperative that we firmly commit ourselves to the protection of civil rights for people of all identities, including the LGBTQ+ community. In doing so, we must be a leader on the world stage and champion LGBTQ+ human rights in the United States and around the globe. (2/3)

Today the House will vote on H.R. 3485, the Global Respect Act. 

This bill imposes visa-blocking sanctions on individuals in other countries who the State Department has identified as having committed human rights violations against people in the LGBTQ+ community. (1/3)

The Postal Service is a vital institution in our country. This bill will modernize its policies to ensure that Americans can enjoy the critical services they provide for generations to come. 
 
It's time to pass this commonsense bill. (3/3)

The Postal Service Reform Act will integrate Medicare for future retirees, eliminate the burdensome pre-fund requirement, generate public performance data, and create a six-day delivery schedule across an integrated delivery network. (2/3)

Americans rely on @USPS, and now the Postal Service is in need of support. 

Today, the House will vote on H.R. 3076, the Postal Service Reform Act of 2022 ‚Äì a bipartisan piece of legislation to strengthen the U.S. Postal Service for generations to come. (1/3)

At a time when adolescent suicide rates are on the rise, we must recommit ourselves to promoting mental health care.

If you or a loved one is in a suicidal crisis or emotional distress call 1-800-273-8255. (3/3)

That's why on #SaferInternetDay, I'm joining @RepSusanWild to call on @YouTube to take down dangerous "How To Tie a Noose" videos and other harmful videos.
 
@YouTube has a duty to foster a safe internet for everyone, especially our kids. It's time to #TakeThemDown. (2/3)

Social media has a tremendous impact on mental health, especially for our young people.

The past few years have shown us the dire need to create a safer internet and demand that social media companies do their part. (1/3)

Yesterday, the Senate voted unanimously to confirm Alice Albright as the next CEO of @MCCgov.

Congratulations, Alice on your confirmation. I look forward to watching you excel in your new role as you advance @MCCgov's vision of reducing global poverty through economic growth.

In Washington State, @pocaaninfo is doing incredible work to provide social services aimed at addressing health disparities - like HIV/AIDS - and other related issues experienced by BIPOC communities across King County.

Learn more about their work: https://t.co/vDBfvkEVb2 (2/4)

Today is National Black HIV/AIDS Awareness Day, a day to acknowledge the progress we've made in HIV prevention and care for the Black community and a day to recommit ourselves to the work still needed to be done. To #StopHIVTogether, we must address #HIVstigma and barriers. (1/4)

Fine print hidden in a lengthy contract shouldn‚Äôt be what stops a survivor from telling their story and getting justice.

I'm voting to #EndForcedArbitration because every survivor deserves their day in court. (3/3)

This bill would allow sexual harassment and sexual assault survivors to elect to file a case in a court of law rather than be subject to mandatory, pre-dispute arbitration.

These forced arbitration clauses are everywhere, protecting those in power and silencing survivors. (2/3)
Today, I‚Äôll vote to pass @RepCheri‚Äôs legislation to #EndForcedArbitration so that survivors of sexual assault and harassment aren‚Äôt blocked from seeking justice. (1/3)
I am committed to ensuring that America‚Äôs rivers, streams, and waterbodies remain protected for generations to come and that communities across the country have access to clean water. (3/3)

Protecting clean water is critical to ensure the health and safety of our communities and the preservation of our natural resources.

The @EPA and the @USACEHQ must restore science-based safeguards for America‚Äôs waters and wetlands. (2/3)

Trump‚Äôs #DirtyWaterRule was an attempt to dismantle the Clean Water Act, which protects America's rivers, streams, and waterbodies.

That's why I joined 120 of @HouseDemocrats demanding the swift repeal and replacement of Trump‚Äôs #DirtyWaterRule. (1/3)

As the #AmericaCOMPETES Act makes its way through the conference process,‚ÄØI look forward to working with my colleagues to reach an agreement in the Senate on a final bill that includes the Adoptee Citizenship Act. (6/6)

The Adoptee Citizenship Act will‚ÄØprovide‚ÄØmuch needed certainty‚ÄØto‚ÄØaffected adoptees, ensure that these individuals have full access to their rights as American citizens, and strengthen our international relationships. (5/6)

These individuals grew up here and started careers and families, but through no fault of their own, they never received citizenship and are living in uncertainty about their future. 

This piece of legislation will finally grant citizenship to these international adoptees. (4/6)
Due to a loophole in the Child Citizenship Act of 2000, many international adoptees who were brought to the U.S. as children were never granted citizenship.‚ÄØ (3/6)

I am incredibly proud that my bill, the Adoptee Citizenship Act, was passed as part of the #AmericaCOMPETES Act, signifying a major step forward for many international adoptees who currently are without citizenship status. (2/6)

Last week the house passed the #AmericaCOMPETES Act, which provides the critical resources and tools we need to compete globally in manufacturing, technology, and innovation, while maintaining strong worker standards and strengthening our national security. (1/6)

Thank you @KentChamber for hosting me for this event. 
 
In Congress, I am committed to advancing legislation that will address the collective issues we face and strengthen the Ninth District and the State of Washington. (2/2)

Yesterday @RepKimSchrier and I joined the @KentChamber to give an update on what's happening right now in Congress. We discussed some of the most pressing issues facing our region and our country: public safety, affordable housing & childcare, and raising the minimum wage. (1/2)

The Adoptee Citizenship Act will‚ÄØprovide‚ÄØmuch needed certainty‚ÄØto‚ÄØaffected adoptees, ensuring that these individuals have full access to their rights as American citizens. 

Read my full statement:
https://t.co/CeA1dTvijn (3/3)

This bipartisan piece of legislation would finally grant citizenship to international adoptees who were brought to the United States as children but were never granted citizenship due to a loophole in the Child Citizenship Act of 2000. (2/3)

I am incredibly proud that my bill, the Adoptee Citizenship Act, was passed today by the House as part of the America COMPETES Act of 2022.

https://t.co/B6fQCwR5oA (3/3)

The America COMPETES Act of 2022 invests in American workers, manufacturing, research, and innovation to power our economy and bolster our competitiveness, ensuring that we can continue to be a leader on global challenges in the future. (2/3)

Today the House passed the #AmericaCOMPETES Act, a package of bills that will bring manufacturing back to the U.S., support our workers, strengthen supply chains, promote international cooperation, and put the U.S. at the forefront of technology and innovation. (1/3)

This bipartisan legislation will also help bring manufacturing jobs back to the United States, creating good-paying jobs for all Americans.

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act will address our nation‚Äôs most pressing challenges and ensure we can compete globally for decades to come. (2/2)

Today the House is voting on the #AmericaCOMPETES Act, which will strengthen our economy and national security by providing $45 billion in funding to bolster supply chains and invest in equipment and technology used to manufacture goods right here in the United States. (1/2)
